justification: Recognizes Team B’s RB need and Team A’s TE weakness, but misses B’s TE surplus and already deep WR room, and doesn’t reflect B’s urgency or consensus-driven mindset. Trade is incoherent for A: giving a Tier 2 deep-threat WR (which A values) plus a usable RB for a Tier 4 TE is a marginal upgrade. Targeting Michael Roberts instead of B’s better TE (Jamal Jones) further weakens logic. Explanation is brief and generic, lacking role/usage and playoff-context detail.
